column4: I need it to be generic so I can use it wherever I may roam, and although I much prefer a cd, I should probably use a floppy until I have it down better so I don't burn through twenty cds.
cd-rw
One sec...  because the only thing harder then what I'm trying to do is digging through piles of CDs!  This may take a minute!
just a suggestion, because I hate floppies.  :)
but remember older machines may not be able to boot from cd
I assume there is an easy way to delete and burn things on this sucker in gnome.
Okay, now what files do I need to dig out for my kernel.
the kernel source archive.
Is that somewhere online, or simply a file on the external's root partition.
will /lib/modules/2.6.12-9-686 work?

Also, the only halfway-run install on the external uses 2.6.12-9-686, while I believe Breezy upgraded to 2.6.12-10-686.  Should I download the newer, or go with the older until I upgrade on my external?
I wouldn't try to figure this out and change kernel versions at the same time.
get it working, then worry about updating the kernel.
http://packages.ubuntu.com/dapper/base/linux-image-2.6.12-9-686 is what I'm looking for, yes?
I think the source has a different name, and you need the source
This, then?: http://packages.ubuntu.com/dapper/source/linux-source-2.6.12
yes, I believe so
linux-source-2.6.12_2.6.12.orig.tar.gz vs linux-source-2.6.12_2.6.12-9.23.diff.gz
the diff is for the case where you are changing kernel versions, already have source, and only want files that have changed
you want all of it.
Obtained!
now you do make xconfig
what does that version have that regular old ubuntu doesn't have?
